runs.comm: slides one past the outside edge from round the stumps
quicker one on middle, he stays inside the crease and turns it towards short midwicket, bowler does well to get across and stop that
pushed back to the bowler, tight line again, not much flight. He's firing them in
attempted switch hit, but mistimes it, straight to point. Didn't get the elevation he was looking for

turned wide of square leg, risky single. The bowler dropped the ball as he tried to break the stumps at the bowler's end. Once that happened, it didn't matter how far the batsman was. Replays show he was well inside though
punched down the ground to long-on
jags away from the length area outside off, beaten as he looks to force it behind point
almost a mirror image to the previous delivery. Once again late on the stroke as it jags away
bunted wide of point for an easy single
slips it down leg, the inward movement beats the pad, easy call for the umpire. Scoring opportunity missed though, any kind of bat on that and it would have beaten short fine leg
thumped past the diving mid-off fielder. It was a firm push, excellent timing. Didn't try to hit it too hard
another delivery down leg side, he swings and misses
looks to whip it away, deflects off the thigh pad towards square leg
straightens it off a length on middle, nicely behind the line as he defends with soft hands
another attempted switch hit, another failed one. Rolls off the pad to short fine leg
super stroke. Didn't quite get to the pitch but went through the line, one bounce inside-out of cover. Sweet timing
fired into middle, skids on after pitching, toe ends a punch to cover
how did that miss the off stump, I don't know. Looks to walk across and sweep it fine, too early into the stroke, missed
just eludes the mid-off fielder, who was running backwards. It was hit over the bowler's head, but didn't get any sort of timing behind that one
shot of the evening. Hit with the spin over cover, no more than a chip but it just kept sailing. What timing
punched through the line to mid-off
hit over mid-off, two bounces into the boundary. Knew what he was doing. Picked the length and lofted it with a straight bat
finds the point fielder this time
looks for a yorker but ends up being a full toss on middle, flicked superbly, splits the gap between midwicket and mid-on
slapped wide of the diving mid-off fielder. Looked to pull, the ball got big on him but he still went through with the stroke. Just eluded the captain
pushed back to the bowler
pulled across the line, finds mid-on. Missed out there, it was sitting up for him to pull it into the gap
whipped over backward square leg, excellent pick-up shot. Used the pace well and wristed it up and over
top edges a pull, this one lands in front of the man running in from third man. Could he have gone for the catch? Maybe
splits the gap between the two point fielders. Steps out, uses the width and crunches it. Speeds away to the boundary
flicked Jayasuriya style towards fine leg. This one was sliding down leg and he flicked it superbly, to add insult to injury, it's a no-ball. Free-hit coming up
full and straight on middle and leg, the angle took it towards the leg side. Dot ball off a free-hit. Could get any bat to it, was perhaps late

errs in line again. Floats it too full and on the pads, excellent pick up shot. Too easy in fact, no one at fine leg and he deposited it there. 50 comes up in super quick time. If Afghanistan were expecting a stroll, they may not have it
punched to mid-off
hit back hard, good stop off his own bowling
full toss outside off, looks to crash that past cover, gets a thick edge that flies past short third man. Not intentional but it doesn't matter
doesn't get to the pitch, forced to point
flicked with the spin into the gap at deep midwicket
doesn't get hold of the lofted hit, lands short of the long on fielder
slider on middle, turned towards the vacant midwicket region
looks to whip it away, beaten by pace as the ball thuds into his thigh pad
wrong-un this time, slides outside off, but the reverse sweep meant the umpire didn't have to call it a wide
reverse paddle to good effect this time. Got it off the bottom of the bat, but enough for it to race away past short third man, they're rattling along
slow turn this time, misses the reverse paddle, didn't miss the leg stump by much, good take by Shahzad
reverse swept fiercely this time, over the point fielder. Got enough bat on it to clear the infield
flicked with the spin over deep midwicket, excellent running, off the blocks just as the fielder fired the throw, luckily for him, it wasn't a powerful one
tucked wide of square leg
wonder at what stage they'll start to treat him as a left-hander. Another reverse sweep, hit straight to point
getting too predictable now, reverse swept to short third man, excellent stop
steps out and lofts it over the infield, superb work by Shafiqullah running around from deep midwicket. Hared across the turf and pushed it back in to the fielder running from long-off
using his angles superbly, what fineness. Opens the bat face at the last moment and dabs it past short third man
spinning down leg, hit on the pad as he looks to drive against the turn
walks across the stumps and slogs it behind square to the boundary rider
crashed towards the man at sweeper cover, weak throw, couldn't have challenged the batsman with that
short third man fielder got a bad bounce, but the momentum meant he dived over the ball as well. Not where he intended; looked to slap it past point, got a thick edge

a lollipop delivery has given them a wicket. It was too short, he looked to pull but didn't get hold of it and found the only man at the boundary, at deep square leg. He takes a dolly. Should come as major relief for Afghanistan
flicked with the angle to deep midwicket

that's as plumb as it can get. This one was a fast leg-cutter that pitched on middle and off, he looked to sweep, but was better off playing straight. Once he was hit on the pad, there was little doubt as to what the umpire's decision was going to be. He raised the finger in a jiffy. Afghanistan are back into this.
slow turn back in, played with soft hands to the point fielder
googly this time, mistimes a pull to midwicket
another wrong-un, struck on the pad but the ball was drifting down leg
slow turn, tucked towards mid-on

freebie as this one spins back in to beat the keeper, runs away into the fine leg boundary. Has spoilt what was a top over. Tries to bowl the conventional legspin this time, kept a touch low and Shahzad couldn't get across quickly
full toss on the pads, flicked into the gap at wide long on

how unfortunate is that? This was drilled into the gap at deep extra cover, but MacLeod slipped as he turned for the second. But there was a glimmer of hope as the throw from the deep came to the wrong end. The bowler nearly had a shy at the stumps, but lobbed a throw to the keeper in the end, Shahzad, who was yelling to get the ball, wasn't going to miss it as he knocks the bails off. Big moment in the match? Three gone in quick time
driven with the spin to long off
driven to cover
steps out and works it across the line to long on
drifting down leg, good take by the keeper as the batsman misses the sweep, easy call for the umpire
turned into the gap at midwicket, the fielder had to come in a long way, enough time for the batsmen to complete the second, of course it helped that the throw was wayward
that's a long hop, gets away with it. Punched to long-off
slow turn away from off stumps, eased towards deep cover

steps out to flick but missed it completely, keeper may have been unsighted as well as the ball spun back in sharply to deflect off the pad, rolls to short fine leg. Has to go down as a missed stumping
pushed to the cover fielder
stays back inside the crease and punches it towards sweeper cover
gets a thick bottom edge as he looks to swing with the spin over midwicket, straight to short fine leg
hit back to the bowler, done in by slow turn. Looked to cut
drops it with soft hands towards cover for a quick single, sensible stuff
gets too close to the ball as he steps out to hit over cover, good stop by Nabi
steps out and works it into the gap between deep midwicket and wide long-on

mighty quick stumping, but was the back foot plonked back in time when the bails came off? It was nicely tossed up wrong-un, he stepped out and then looked to sweep, missed it completely as the keeper removed the bails. The back foot was at least a metre outside the crease, and it was too late by the time he tried to drag it back. He's made up for the lapse in the previous over. Afghanistan continue to make inroads after that strong start.
swept with the angle to short fine leg
gets a thick edge but a good stop by the short third man fielder keeps it down to a single
beaten by the sharp turn from outside off, square turn there, slowing it up nicely
whipped towards the man running in from deep midwicket
slogged across the line, a misfield by Nabi at midwicket gives them an extra run
tossed up outside off, he waits for the ball to spin back in and taps it to the off side
mistimes an attempted hit over midwicket, got it off the thick inside edge, another misfield by Nabi gave them a second
spins back in to take the inside edge onto the pad
paddled straight to short fine leg
mistimes a pull towards deep midwicket, good work by Shafiqullah
looks to paddle, but was too short, pulled to long on in the end
slapped towards long-off, not much pace on that delivery. The batsman had to force the pace
swept wide of short fine leg
low full toss on middle, driven back to the bowler, long-off does well to get around and keep it down to a run
dabbed with soft hands towards point for a quick single
paddled to short fine leg, they scamper through for another run
steps out and works it down to long on
can't get to the pitch as he steps out, worked with the spin to long on
squeezed wide of point, risky run, they manage to get through as the throw wasn't direct
the fielder running in from deep midwicket misjudged it slightly, perhaps picked it up a little too late. He simply chipped it with the spin. Is luck smiling on Scotland?
quicker one outside off, punched wide of cover
drilled back over the bowler's head, the long-off fielder anticipated the stroke and moved swiftly to his right
pulled, but straight to long on
nice and full, batsman looked to open the bat face and squeeze it wide of point, gets an edge to third man instead
low full toss, looks to clear cover, can't get any power or timing, just lands short of the fielder there
steps out and works it towards deep midwicket
excellent yorker, full and tailing away from middle, can only get it as far as the cover fielder
looked to play the dilscoop, changed his mind and played a delicate dab down to third man instead
another scoop, another miss. Bowler saw him attempting the stroke and fired it full and wide

superb yorker, not much room for the batsman to work with, somehow squeezes it past the bowler, long-on fielder switched off for a split second, enough for them to steal a second. Shahzad is clearly not happy with that effort

excellent stroke, much-needed too. Walked across, it was right in the slot for him to swung, he gave it a mighty thwack to the legcutter and generated enough power as he hit it straight over the bowler's head for a maximum

flicked towards deep midwicket, the throw was full at the keeper's end, maybe he would have been better off firing a flat one on the bounce, lost a second or two by throwing it full, by which time the batsman dived back in full stretch
flat hit to the man at the edge of the circle at mid-off
backs away and the bowler follows him by firing it down leg, whipped towards wide long on, the fielder chose the wrong end, but Afghanistan won't mind singles and twos here
backs away, but Nabi fires it full and wide outside off, couldn't reach out for it in the end, just a touch outside the wide line, as replays suggest. Lucky to get away
worked across the line towards deep midwicket, they scamper back for the second, but had to use every ounce of his energy to complete it, he's left panting in the end

swung across the line, can only slice it to the point fielder. The pressure has got to him, he simply had to tee off. Afghanistan wold believe they are into the home stretch. Industrious innings, but couldn't bring out the big hits when he had to
flat hit but straight to long-off
rip roaring bouncer, looks to pull but is beaten for pace, good take by the keeper. 137 clicks that
slower one, this time he dabs it down towards third man, excellent dive by Noor Ali, desperation saves a couple of runs. Didn't have the pace to run away
looks to pull, too late on the stroke, hit high on the bat, bowler runs across to collect the ball, doesn't bother firing a throw at the bowler's end

as far as effort deliveries go, this should be right up there. Pacy bouncer angled into the body, the batsman has no room to work with, gets a bit of glove on it as the ball flies over Shahzad's head, looks like he also got a touch on that as he leaped high, took the pace off for third man to stop it
pulled but straight to deep square leg
excellent yorker, squeezed to midwicket
